title: fix(#1054): reduce collapsable area. Optimize for annotation
fix: convert pd.NaT to None for event_timestamp

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

body:
When providing a pandas `NaT` as `event_timestamp`, the server response is:
```python
import rubrix as rb

rec = rb.TextClassificationRecord(inputs="test", event_timestamp=pd.NaT)
rb.log(rec, "test")
""" output
ValidationApiError: Rubrix server returned an error with http status: 422
Error details: [{'code': 'rubrix.api.errors::ValidationError', 'params': {'model': 'Request', 'errors': [{'loc': ['body', 'records', 0, 'event_timestamp'], 'msg': 'invalid datetime format', 'type': 'value_error.datetime', 'value': 'NaT'}]}}]
"""
```
This PR converts pandas `NaT` to `None` when provided as input to a Rubrix client model.

title: docs(#1089): correct readme installation guide
The client noticed that the server is not a supported distribution of Elasticsearch
body:
Hi All, Was trying to install today on a Macbook (Intel) and hitting this error
Version: 0.9.0


```
raise UnsupportedProductError(message)
elasticsearch.exceptions.UnsupportedProductError: The client noticed that the server is not a supported distribution of Elasticsearch
```

Here are the details of the setup process
```
# Create a directory for notebooks and another to download data 
mkdir -p rubrix/notebooks rubrix/data 

# CD into the directory
cd rubrix

# Create and activate a conda environment
conda create -n rubrix python=3.8 -y
conda activate rubrix

# Pip install the necessary libraries
pip install -U jupyterlab pandas matplotlib tqdm ipywidgets 
pip install -U "rubrix[server]" snorkel datasets

# Run the ES Docker container
docker run -d \
 --name elasticsearch-for-rubrix \
 -p 9200:9200 -p 9300:9300 \
 -e "ES_JAVA_OPTS=-Xms512m -Xmx512m" \
 -e "discovery.type=single-node" \
 docker.elastic.co/elasticsearch/elasticsearch-oss:7.10.2

# Run the Rubrix server
python -m rubrix
```

Please let me know if there's any other information needed from me to troubleshoot this issue. Appreciate the help!

title: refactor(#945): normalizes input and output record fields
body:
This PR normalized incoming and outgoing record level fields. 

- Some returned records from API has no sense (like `annotated_as`, or `predicted_by`) since they are computed from other record fields.
- `raw_text` field for token classification becomes to `text` field, but keeping backward compatibility with old clients during some versions
- UI model now uses this new `text` field for token classification.

See #945

It's this info still valuable ? In that case, could we generalize this feature for the rest of nlp tasks?

Just a work step in tasks described in #945

title: [NER Fine tuning] content selection
body:
### Multi word

Actual state : (VIEW SS)
1- I select various words, highlight is grey and in a solid block (Highlight/words).
2- When selection is done, highlight selection is splited and label selector appears.

- [x] Should be:

1- I select various words, highlight is grey and splited (highlight/word)
2- When selection is done, highlight selection is a solid block label selector appears.

### Delete labelling

- [x] Make clicable the whole tooltip to delete

### Selection on a searched word

- [x] Selection highlight should not be cut (SS)
- [x] When selection is containing a search word the label selector does not appear (how it works only on right>left sense)
- [x] In general : change appearance of results : in place of Orange highlight show text in *bold*

### Cursor 

- [x] Active "hand" cursor (pointer) on piece of text already annotated/Predicted
- [x] Active "Text Select" cursor on the rest of record
- [x] Enlarge the hover state to the whole area : (record + annotated tooltip + empty space between them) (record + predicted tooltip + empty space between us)

### New Select label modal

- [x] Integrate new UI modal
- [x] In case of unique label, dont show modal, and just affect label after selecting text
- [x] Add logic to show first and preselected the last label used
- [x] Add following Keyboard shortcut: Enter to valid preselected label, and vertical arrow keyboard or Number to valid other labels

title: [Token Classification] mention spans validation still fails with some tokenization

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

labels.name: area: server
labels.description: Indicates that an issue or pull request is related to the server

body:
This record will fail:

```python
TokenClassificationRecord(
        text="This is Mr.Bean",
        tokens=[
            "This",
            "is",
            "Mr.",
            "Bean"
        ],
        annotation=TokenClassificationAnnotation(
            agent="test",
            entities=[EntitySpan(start=11, end=15, label="PERSON")],
        ),
    )
```

title: [RuleMetrics] Overall precision should be calculated from overall correct/incorrect

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

body:
For example, in the screenshot below, the overall precision should be 170 / (170+45) = 0.79 .

![Screenshot from 2022-01-27 17-44-17](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15979778/151405734-e3e60476-31cd-4f04-b49a-a7cf4af4ed6f.png)

I think this is more meaningful than the average of the precisions, since it weighs each precision with its annot. coverage. For example, if I have one 100% precise rule that covers almost the whole dataset, and one 0% precise rule that only covers one record, now it would show me a 50% precision, but the weak labels from a simple majority voter would almost always be correct. 
 
Right now, I think we compute the average of the precisions, but taking the NaNs as 0 into account, which seems like a bug.

@frascuchon @leiyre Not sure who to assign this one to?

title: [Labelling Rules] Remove prediction ok/ko from records
feat(#422): add possibility to load datasets as a `datasets.Dataset`
body:
Closes #422 

Adds a new `format` argument to the `rb.load` method. `format` can be one of `pandas`, `rubrix`, or `datasets`, and defines the output format/type of the returned dataset.

title: refactor(#924): better client error management
body:
This PR changes how client handles incoming API errors.

The idea is to contextualize incoming errors by defining a client error hierarchy, including an operation context giving more details about inputs that raised the error.

Not totally cover solution discussed in #924 but it will help to understand the api error reason. Even more in combination with changes in #1031

title: Fix(#1028): Add videos to Monitoring tutorial
Fix(#1027): Improve client models by reordering fields + forbidding extra args

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

body:
Closes #1027 

With this PR the client models raise an error when extra arguments are provided. The error message is not the clearest though, but i did not find a way to modify this. @frascuchon Do you know how to customize validation error messages in pydantic?

It also fixes the order of the fields in the models. This is important when converting the records into a DataFrame/Dataset, so that when displaying a DataFrame the order of the columns is more or less meaningful.

title: [Errors] Provide clear messages about Elasticsearch status when running the server

labels.name: area: server
labels.description: Indicates that an issue or pull request is related to the server

body:
I don't know where is the best place but I would like to have a very clear message when some starts the server and the Elasticsearch endpoint is not available/running, etc, I don't know if we check that at some point but I recall the message it's a standard trace. We should be very informative at this point, explaining:

We checked the elastic search endpoint at {ES_URL} and is not responding/available..
Please make sure your Elasticsearch is running, or (check the user roles config) <- whatever message it makes sense.
Ideally this should be applicable to other scenarios when the ES instance is not responding --> including a trace in the server process.

I think this is key to help our users troubleshoot the issues with Elastic which is frequently the only bottleneck for getting started.

title: feat(#945): change es analyzers using environment variables

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Indicates new feature requests

body:
Since rubrix stops using index template for dataset records index creation (See #1018), there is no way to customize the text fields analyzer.

This PR includes a basic mechanism to change the es analyzers. In the future, this parameters could be as part of dataset settings when creating a new dataset.

title: refactor(#945): elasticsearch index configuration per task
body:
This PR mainly change flow for elasticsearch dataset indices creation. After changes in this PR, no index template will be created/used and dataset records index mappings will be configured depending on its task.

Also, in this PR we include a text field normalization defined in #945, that will be able in new datasets. We still keep old fields (like `words`,...) for backward compatibility purposes. In futures releases those fields will be dropped.

Closes #1012

title: [Weak supervision] Simplified version of the skweak tutorial.
body:
This is an initial draft of the simplified version of the skweak tutorial. These are the next steps before we have a working version:

- Save the preprocessed dataset to the Rubrix repository and turn the Preprocessing section into an appendix.
- Visualize the data and improve the regular expressions. 
- Introduce a baseline.
- Show how the rules can be created with Rubrix through gifs / screenshots.
- Add clear descriptions to each section. 

Closes #942

title: chore(#994): simplify server start
body:
This PR changes how to launch rubrix server to:

```bash
python -m rubrix
```

The old command (`python -m rubrix.server`) is also available 

Also, include setup info about uvicorn setup. Basically, you can launch rubrix server using uvicorn:

```bash
uvicorn rubrix:app
```

title: [Datasets] Avoid using global template for all indices
body:
Separate per task index configuration must be applied to create specific fields configuration per tasks. 

We can define 3 different index_templates, sharing a common `_component_template` and one specific mapping section depending the task.

News indices will be created according the dataset task

```python

----> 1 wl = WeakLabels(dataset="facsarss_category_v2")

~/recognai/rubrix/src/rubrix/labeling/text_classification/weak_labels.py in __init__(self, dataset, rules, ids, query, label2int)
    106                 or f"rule_{index}"
    107             )
--> 108             for index, rule in enumerate(rules)
    109         }
    110         # raise error if there are duplicates

TypeError: 'NoneType' object is not iterable
```

title: [Annotation] Annotating TextClassificationRecords sets the event_timestamp to None

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

body:
When annotating text classification records via the web app, the event_timestap is lost.
```python
rec = rb.TextClassificationRecord(inputs="test", prediction=[("a", 0.5), ("b", 0.5)], event_timestamp=datetime.now())
rb.log(rec, "test_event_timestamp")
rb.load("test_event_timestamp")   # event_timestamp is fine
# annotate the record in the web app
rb.load("test_event_timestamp")   # event_timestamp is None
```

title: fix(#1002): Show 0 records overall metrics when no rules defined
body:
fix #1002
This PR fixes "NaN records" in metrics when no rules in Rules Summary

title: fix(statics): handle 404 errors for static files

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

body:
This PR allows refresh pages in rubrix app, since the default behaviour is a 404 response message.

The `starlette.get_response` behind has changed since some release and now, we must catch `HTTPException` too.

This fix will allow open datasets in another tab, for example.

title: refactor: Rename 'exclude_missing_annotation' argument for WeakLabels.annotation
body:
This PR contains a renaming of the 'exclude_missin_annotation' arg to 'include_missing'. Default behavior stays the same.
This renaming is more adequate and improves consistency within the labeling module, where we normally have `include_*` arguments.
